title: Eden Park
summary: Eden Park is New Zealand's largest sports stadium.[6] Located in central Auckland, New Zealand's largest city, it is three kilometres southwest of the CBD, on the boundary between the suburbs of Mount Eden and Kingsland.  Although used primarily for rugby union in winter and cricket in summer, it has hosted rugby league and association football matches. In 2011 it hosted pool games, two quarter-finals, both semi-finals and the final of 2011 Rugby World Cup. In doing so it became the first stadium in the world to host two Rugby World Cup Finals, having held the inaugural final in 1987.[7] It was a venue for the 2015 Cricket World Cup, which was jointly hosted by Australia and New Zealand.[8]
